issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera
Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.raw:
Ok, it seems like a good idea to mention that you work on something to avoid redundant work (I should note this for future).

I have not tested it on windows but it should fix mentioned compile errors (and a few others of the same type).

https://bitbucket.org/0xb000/gazebo/branches/compare/0xb000/gazebo:wideanglecamera%0Dosrf/gazebo:default#diff

issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.html:
When compiling on windows this week i had some minor issues:

had to

#undef ERROR

in rest_response.pb.h

and in some of the Files that showed the above error C2027 i had to either add a default destructor like

/// \brief Private fields of camera lens
class CameraLensPrivate
{

  public: ~CameraLensPrivate() = default;

  /// \brief Linear scale factor

or remove it:

  //public: ~CameraLens() = default;

Currently having some issues with hg and no time to re-build from scratch, will try to commit a pull request in the new year. I felt those lines might help someone maybe and as I'll be in vacation for a few weeks didn't want to hold it back until I have a neat pull request and all.

Apart from those issues a number of paths were not set correctly when going through the tutorial, I added some to LIB and INCLUDE as needed. There might be some extra dependencies that are not included in the list the tutorials gives, I would have to check with a clean install.

issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.raw:
Looks similar to an issue I had, i guess ERROR is defined somewhere upstream as a preprocessor macro and gets expanded here, leading to an error.
You can try setting an 
"#undef ERROR "
somewhere before the typedef.
A real solution would be to check where the ERROR macro definition comes from and to change it there, or to change the name ERROR in the protobuffer msg definition. There could be side effects however, so "hacking" the generated .hh would be the first thing to try.
content.html: Looks similar to an issue I had, i guess ERROR is defined somewhere upstream as a preprocessor macro and gets expanded here, leading to an error. You can try setting an "#undef ERROR " somewhere before the typedef. A real solution would be to check where the ERROR macro definition comes from and to change it there, or to change the name ERROR in the protobuffer msg definition. There could be side effects however, so "hacking" the generated .hh would be the first thing to try.

issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.raw:
I guess the atomic_bool problem should be Stackoverflow'able ;) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15750917/initializing-stdatomic-bool 
Seems to be a bug in the MS compiler.
content.html: I guess the atomic_bool problem should be Stackoverflow'able ;) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15750917/initializing-stdatomic-bool Seems to be a bug in the MS compiler.

issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.raw:
According to http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_on_windows&cat=install, 


```
#!c++

At this moment, compilation has been tested on Windows 7 and 8.1 and is supported when using Visual Studio 2013. Patches for other versions are welcome.
```

I'm using VS2013, so I guess 6.1 isn't the version of gazebo the guy who wrote the tutorial used. Unfortunately the exact version isn't specified in the tutorial.

Edit: in the top right corner it says "Version: 6.0"... so I tried compiling 6.0 instead and got a truck load of new issues during configure stage.. back to THIS again..
content.html:
According to http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_on_windows&cat=install, 

At this moment, compilation has been tested on Windows 7 and 8.1 and is supported when using Visual Studio 2013. Patches for other versions are welcome.

I'm using VS2013, so I guess 6.1 isn't the version of gazebo the guy who wrote the tutorial used. Unfortunately the exact version isn't specified in the tutorial.

Edit: in the top right corner it says "Version: 6.0"... so I tried compiling 6.0 instead and got a truck load of new issues during configure stage.. back to THIS again..

issue.title: Windows compilation errors related to WideAngleCamera

content.raw:
Hi, 
I've managed to compile gazebo version 7 and all the plugins and lib under windows 7 MCVS12 64bits
I'll probably make a pull request but I didn't did it in a very elegant way so I don't what it's worth.

Here's a list of the modification I did but I'm afraid I forgot to note some:

Change configure.bat according to paths and compilers used. Need to be runned 2 times ... dunno why.

Working compilations (in order of dependencies)
gazebomsgs_out .........OK
gazebo_math ............OK
gazebo_common ..........OK
gazebo_msgs ............OK
gazebo_transport .......OK
gzqtpropertybrowser ....OK
gazebo_util ............OK
gazebo_rendering .......OK  --> very long compilation time
gazebo_gui .............OK
gzclient ...............OK

DON'T FORGET TO SET BUILD_TYPE TO RELEASE WHEN COMPILING UNDER VS


in D:\gz-ws\boost_1_56_0\boost\utility\detail\result_of_iterate.hpp 
	add typename at l128:
		typedef decltype(


in WideAngleCamera.hh
	add in includes
		#include "gazebo/rendering/CameraLensPrivate.hh"
	comment l66:
		public: ~CameraLens() = default;


in CMakeList.txt of gazebo_msgs
	the output gazebomsgs_out.exe is created under ./Release instead of the directory, provoking errors because protoc.exe, which uses 
	gazebomsgs_out.exe as a pluging couldn't find it. As a way to fix that, changed in the CMakeList.txt the path to the pluging
	-->Need to make it proper so that when using NMake instead of MCVS it looks in the current dir and not Release.


in GLWidget.cc
	l920 change to:
		ogreHandle = std::to_string((int)this->winId());


in rest_response.proto
	change the variable ERROR to _ERROR to avoid collision with existing define 



in CameraLensPrivate.hh
	add
		#include <functional>
		

```
#!c++

#define decltype(...) std::common_type<decltype(__VA_ARGS__)>::type
```

	workaround for a VS bug (cf doc)
	add 	

```
#!c++

#undef decltype(...) std::common_type<decltype(__VA_ARGS__)>::type
```

	otherwise provoke error in boost when declare type in result_of_iterate.hpp


in CMakeList.txt general
	reduced warning from all to 4 (Wall to W4) it was warning for padding ....


Good luck with that
content.html:
Hi, I've managed to compile gazebo version 7 and all the plugins and lib under windows 7 MCVS12 64bits I'll probably make a pull request but I didn't did it in a very elegant way so I don't what it's worth.

Here's a list of the modification I did but I'm afraid I forgot to note some:

Change configure.bat according to paths and compilers used. Need to be runned 2 times ... dunno why.

Working compilations (in order of dependencies) gazebomsgs_out .........OK gazebo_math ............OK gazebo_common ..........OK gazebo_msgs ............OK gazebo_transport .......OK gzqtpropertybrowser ....OK gazebo_util ............OK gazebo_rendering .......OK --> very long compilation time gazebo_gui .............OK gzclient ...............OK

DON'T FORGET TO SET BUILD_TYPE TO RELEASE WHEN COMPILING UNDER VS

in D:\gz-ws\boost_1_56_0\boost\utility\detail\result_of_iterate.hpp add typename at l128: typedef decltype(

in WideAngleCamera.hh add in includes #include "gazebo/rendering/CameraLensPrivate.hh" comment l66: public: ~CameraLens() = default;

in CMakeList.txt of gazebo_msgs the output gazebomsgs_out.exe is created under ./Release instead of the directory, provoking errors because protoc.exe, which uses gazebomsgs_out.exe as a pluging couldn't find it. As a way to fix that, changed in the CMakeList.txt the path to the pluging -->Need to make it proper so that when using NMake instead of MCVS it looks in the current dir and not Release.

in GLWidget.cc l920 change to: ogreHandle = std::to_string((int)this->winId());

in rest_response.proto change the variable ERROR to _ERROR to avoid collision with existing define

in CameraLensPrivate.hh add #include <functional>

#define decltype(...) std::common_type<decltype(__VA_ARGS__)>::type

workaround for a VS bug (cf doc)
add

#undef decltype(...) std::common_type<decltype(__VA_ARGS__)>::type

otherwise provoke error in boost when declare type in result_of_iterate.hpp

in CMakeList.txt general reduced warning from all to 4 (Wall to W4) it was warning for padding ....

Good luck with that
